title: (x) Carolina Golf logo - Brassett {Mike F}
content:
Can anyone ID this. Reminds me of…  
http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/popular-cafe-nf/popular-cafe-nf/  
but that’s not right.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [carolina.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065126/http:/typophile.com/files/carolina.jpg) | 13.11 KB |
author: evan

comments.content:
I think you could re-create this using the Nick’s Font you found and Jim Spiece’s [Quaint Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065126/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/quaint-gothic-sg/), which would only need some serifs removed from the A, N and R. With a bit of clipping of Nick’s G, I think you’d have it.

Bottom line: Carolina Golf could be a customized mix of these two fonts.

- Mike Yanega

So it does! Good spot (once again) Mike. Even better than knowing how to fake a font, is knowing where the actual font can be found.

_There must be a principle like Ockham’s Razor when it comes to fonts too — the simplest explanation is almost always the right one._

- Mike Yanega
